18616.summary: David A. Stockman, the director of the Office of Management and Budget, publicly acknowledged for the first time today that some states might suffer a net loss of Federal money after 1987 as a result of President Reagan's ''new federalism'' proposals.   Administration officials have repeatedly said that there would be ''no winners or losers'' if Congress approved the President's plan to hand o ver con trol of more than 40 Federal programs to the states. In his State of the Union Message, Mr. Reagan said the plan would also include a ''f inancially equal swap'' in which the Federal Government would assume all Medicaid costs in exchange for the states' taking over the welf are and food stamp programs.   However, under intensive questioning by Democratic senators today, Mr. Stockman said that the promise of ''no winners or losers'' applied only to the first phase of the initiative, ending in 1987.

metadata.supported-summary-sentences: David A. Stockman, the director of the Office of Management and Budget, publicly acknowledged for the first time today that some states might suffer a net loss of Federal money after 1987 as a result of President Reagan's ''new federalism'' proposals.   Administration officials have repeatedly said that there would be ''no winners or losers'' if Congress approved the President's plan to hand o ver con trol of more than 40 Federal programs to the states. In his State of the Union Message, Mr. Reagan said the plan would also include a ''f inancially equal swap'' in which the Federal Government would assume all Medicaid costs in exchange for the states' taking over the welf are and food stamp programs.    However, under intensive questioning by Democratic senators today, Mr. Stockman said that the promise of ''no winners or losers'' applied only to the first phase of the initiative, ending in 1987.

20786.summary: WOMEN OF MUSIC   Tonight's concert, ''Composers and Friends,'' is the second of four in the fourth Women's Music Festival sponsored by the Women's Interart Center.   Tania Leon, Katherine Hoover, Wendy Chamber and Julie Kabat will perform their own works plus a scherzo for piano by Clara Schumann, composer and pianist and the wife of Robert Schumann. After his death, she became a concert pianist to support their seven children.   Miss Leon, a founder of the Brooklyn Philharmonia Community Concert Series, is a composer, conductor and pianist. She uses all of those talents in her work with the Dance Theater of Harlem. Miss Hoover, a flutist, founded and is co-director of the Women's Music Festival.  She teaches at the Manhattan School of Music and is researching and writing about women and music. Miss Kabat, a singer, will perform two of her own compositions. Miss Chambers has composed music for children's toys, vacuum cleaners, television sets, automobile horns and ''Music for Choreographed Rowboats'' - for two conductors and 24 brass and wind instruments rowed in formation on the Central Park lake by the Columbia University crew.

metadata.supported-summary-sentences: WOMEN OF MUSIC   Tonight's concert, ''Composers and Friends,'' is the second of four in the fourth Women's Music Festival sponsored by the Women's Interart Center.   Tania Leon, Katherine Hoover, Wendy Chamber and Julie Kabat will perform their own works plus a scherzo for piano by Clara Schumann, composer and pianist and the wife of Robert Schumann. After his death, she became a concert pianist to support their seven children.   Miss Leon, a founder of the Brooklyn Philharmonia Community Concert Series, is a composer, conductor and pianist. She uses all of those talents in her work with the Dance Theater of Harlem. Miss Hoover, a flutist, founded and is co-director of the Women's Music Festival.  She teaches at the Manhattan School of Music and is researching and writing about women and music. Miss Kabat, a singer, will perform two of her own compositions. Miss Chambers has composed music for children's toys, vacuum cleaners, television sets, automobile horns and ''Music for Choreographed Rowboats'' - for two conductors and 24 brass and wind instruments rowed in formation on the Central Park lake by the Columbia University crew.

16992.summary: With the strong encouragement and cooperation of Chinese publishing officials, the Association of American Publishers will mount in six cities in China from May 12 to 25 the biggest international exhibition it has ever assembled anywhere of English-language books. Six hundred publishers as well as the Government Printing Office are participating, and 20,000 titles in every field will be shown.   There is a political as well as commercial undertone to the exhibition, American publishers point out, because the Federal Government denied funds to underwrite a similar display of books from the United States at the international book fair scheduled for September in Moscow. By contrast, the International Communications Agency is providing the publishers with $350,000 to help mount the show in China.

metadata.supported-summary-sentences: With the strong encouragement and cooperation of Chinese publishing officials, the Association of American Publishers will mount in six cities in China from May 12 to 25 the biggest international exhibition it has ever assembled anywhere of English-language books. Six hundred publishers as well as the Government Printing Office are participating, and 20,000 titles in every field will be shown.   There is a political as well as commercial undertone to the exhibition, American publishers point out, because the Federal Government denied funds to underwrite a similar display of books from the United States at the international book fair scheduled for September in Moscow. By contrast, the International Communications Agency is providing the publishers with $350,000 to help mount the show in China.
